intro: Noccaea torreana, commonly known as the Torrean miner's lettuce, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves that are spoon-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. Noccaea torreana is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, well-drained environments.
